NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Laboratory, optical and precision equipments (excl. glasses)

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01B02

SHORT_DESCR.P: The aim of this tender is to select a vendor for the manufacturing, delivery and installation of a femtosecond laser machining system that produces, through a one- or 2-step process of laser writing and (optionally) chemical etching, 3-dimensional structures with spatial dimensions down to a micron, including micro-channels and -chambers, mechanical elements, optical structures, surface topographies, and Micromolds, out of a single volume of fused silica glass and, optionally, out of transparent polymer, to be used in the TU/e BioPlan project.

A femtosecond laser machining system will be used, through a one- or 2-step process of laser writing and (optionally) chemical etching, to perform spatially selected modification of the physical property or ablation of glass or other materials in 3D, with accuracy in micrometer scales, enabling to create micro-channels and –chambers, mechanical elements, optical structures, surface topographies, and Micromolds. The system should at least have these capabilities:

— it should be possible to create a Micromold containing arrays of structures with a rod-like shape that have a diameter of 2 μm or smaller as well as an aspect ratio of 20 or higher; the mold should have a tapering angle of less than 5 degrees,
— the laser focal point can move by 25 mm in Z with position resolution of 100 nm, repeatability < 1um and absolute accuracy over the whole range of +/-1,5 um,

— the X-Y stage has a range of minimum 100x100 mm with position resolution of 100 nm, repeatability < 1um and absolute accuracy over the whole range of +/-1,5 um. The systems should have on-line imaging capability for process monitoring,
— software for controlling and image data acquisition should be included.
